tribe_name: Native Village of Barrow Inupiat Traditional Government

awards.description: THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF BARROW WILL BUILD CAPACITY WITH TRIBAL STAFF AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM STAFF&RSQUOANDS EXPERIENCE IN RESEARCHING, IDENTIFYING, APPLYING FOR, AND SUCCESSFULLY MANAGING NEW GRANTS THAT ADDRESS THE ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES DETAILED IN THE REQUIRED ETEP. THE TRIBE WILL DEVELOP ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES REGARDING CURRENT WATER RESOURCES AND CLIMATE CHANGE. CLIMATE CHANGE ISSUES WILL BE IDENTIFIED, AND POTENTIAL REMEDIES WILL BE DOCUMENTED FOR DISTRIBUTION TO FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL ENTITIES. INCREASE TRIBAL COUNCIL MEMBERS KNOWLEDGE OF ALL ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS AND RESOURCES IDENTIFIED TO SUPPORT LONG-TERM TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL GOALS. CREATE AND MANAGE BUDGETS AND MAINTAIN RECORDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH GRANT CONDITIONS AND FEDERAL REPORTING STANDARDS.

DISTRIBUTIONS FOR SELF GOVERNANCE COMPACTS (TPA BASE) CR1/CR2; WELFARE ASSISTANCE INITIAL (14.7% BASED ON 2020 EST. NEED)/CR#2 (APPX 8.2% OF 2020 EST. NEED) AND CONTRACT SUPPORT CR#1 (14.21%) AND CR#2 (7.92%) OF 2019 ENACTED
SELF GOVERNANCE COMPACTS FY 21 CR1 (19.73%) TPA BASE DIST.
SELF GOVERNANCE COMPACTS FY 22 CR1 (17.53%) TPA BASE DIST.

DISTS. FOR TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM AND TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING FOR ACTIVITIES/PROJECTS DESCRIBED IN 23 USC 202(A) AND A FHWA APPROVED TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (TIP), 23 USC 202(C)(3).

awards.awarding_agency: Department of Housing and Urban Development
Department of Housing and Urban Development
